title: How to Make a Nerf Gun out of Household Items

steps.title: Saw off both ends of a Crayola marker.
steps.content: Saw off both ends of a Crayola marker. Remove the marker’s cap and cut off both ends of the marker with a hacksaw. On the end with the marker tip, be sure to cut off the narrow plastic part, too, so you’re left with a plastic tube that’s uniform in diameter. [1] X Research source You can make this gun with 1 ⁄ 2 in (1.3 cm) PVC pipe, as well. A marker is a great (and cheap) substitute since most people have one laying around the house. [2] X Research source If you don’t have a hacksaw handy, use a Dremel tool for this. Be careful using sharp cutting tools since they can be dangerous. If you're a kid, ask an adult to help you out with this part.

steps.title: Remove the ink cartridge inside the plastic tube.
steps.content: Remove the ink cartridge inside the plastic tube. Once you saw off the ends, the cartridge should pop out easily. You can use a screwdriver to pop the ink cartridge out if it’s being stubborn. Watch out, though! Handling the ink cartridge can get a bit messy. [3] X Research source Do this part outside or over a trash can to prevent any messes. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Push a drill bit through the tube to smooth out the inside.
steps.content: Push a drill bit through the tube to smooth out the inside. You’ll see a few small plastic prongs inside the tubing; those need to be removed so your darts launch properly. Use a drill to quickly file down the prongs so the inside of the tube is perfectly smooth. [5] X Research source If you don’t have a drill, use a file to smooth out the prongs. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Attach a regular balloon to the tube’s narrow end.
steps.content: Attach a regular balloon to the tube’s narrow end. One end of the marker is slightly narrower than the other end, but you have to look closely to tell! Once you identify the narrow end, slip the round lip of a regular balloon over the end and pull the balloon neck up the tube about 1 in (2.5 cm). [7] X Research source

steps.title: Secure the balloon in place with a zip tie.
steps.content: Secure the balloon in place with a zip tie. Wrap a zip tie around the plastic tube to hold the balloon firmly in place. One regular zip tie should do the trick. [8] X Research source If you want to make your gun look cooler, wrap the plastic tube with black electrical tape to hide the white areas and the Crayola logo.

steps.title: Blow a puff of air into the tube’s open end to partially inflate the balloon.
steps.content: Blow a puff of air into the tube’s open end to partially inflate the balloon. Once the balloon is attached, bring the plastic tube up to your mouth. Blow a puff of air into the open end of the tube so the balloon inflates about halfway. You don't need to fully inflate the balloon for this. [9] X Research source Be sure to load and shoot the dart right after you inflate the balloon! The balloon will slowly deflate on its own.

steps.title: Insert a Nerf dart into the open end of the plastic tube.
steps.content: Insert a Nerf dart into the open end of the plastic tube. A regular Nerf dart should fit perfectly into the marker tube. If your dart is pretty new, slide it in about halfway. For older darts, push it all the way into the tube. [10] X Research source Don’t push the dart beyond the other end of the tube. It won't work if the dart falls into the balloon. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Aim at your target and squeeze the balloon to shoot the dart.
steps.content: Aim at your target and squeeze the balloon to shoot the dart. Now for the fun part! Point the open end of the tube at your target. Then, just squeeze the balloon with your hand to shoot the dart. [12] X Research source Try making homemade targets out of paper plates. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Buy 1⁄2 in (1.3 cm) PVC pipe and cut it down to 2 ft (0.61 m) long.
steps.content: Buy 1 ⁄ 2 in (1.3 cm) PVC pipe and cut it down to 2 ft (0.61 m) long. Nerf darts fit perfectly inside a 1 ⁄ 2 in (1.3 cm) PVC pipe! Use a table saw, hacksaw, or Dremel tool to cut down the pipe so that it’s 2 ft (0.61 m) long. [14] X Research source You can buy regular white PVC pipe at any home improvement store. Get an adult to help you with tools like saws and drills.

steps.title: Drill a nail-sized hole 3 in (7.6 cm) from the end of the pipe.
steps.content: Drill a nail-sized hole 3 in (7.6 cm) from the end of the pipe. Use a drill to make a hole through the side of the pipe. You only need to drill through one side; don't drill all the way through to the other side. [15] X Research source The most common nail sizes are 1–2 in (2.5–5.1 cm) in length.

steps.title: Poke a nail through the hole and superglue it in place.
steps.content: Poke a nail through the hole and superglue it in place. File the end of the nail down so that it fits perfectly into the hole and pipe without jutting out at all. Make sure the nail fits snugly and superglue it in place. [16] X Research source The nail prevents Nerf darts from falling into your mouth when you’re shooting your blow gun. If you're using a nail that's shorter than 1 in (2.5 cm) long, you probably won't have to file it down much (or at all).

steps.title: Sand down both ends of the pipe to make them smooth.
steps.content: Sand down both ends of the pipe to make them smooth. Run a piece of sandpaper over both ends of the tube so the openings are perfectly smooth. Wipe away the sanding dust when you’re done. [17] X Research source You can also use a sanding block for this.

steps.title: Wrap the pipe with electrical or duct tape for a sleek look.
steps.content: Wrap the pipe with electrical or duct tape for a sleek look. You don’t have to do this, but it makes your homemade Nerf gun look a lot cooler! For a black gun, wrap the pipe in electrical tape. If you want a silver barrel, use duct tape instead. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Cut 6 pieces of PVC that are each 2 in (5.1 cm) long to add an ammo holder.
steps.content: Cut 6 pieces of PVC that are each 2 in (5.1 cm) long to add an ammo holder. Use a hacksaw, table saw, or Dremel tool to cut 6 pieces of leftover PVC; make each piece 2 in (5.1 cm) long. Hold the longer piece of PVC about 6 in (15 cm) from the end. Pack the 6 short pieces lengthwise around the long pipe until it's completely surrounded. Then, use 2 zip ties to hold everything in place. [19] X Research source You don’t have to add the ammo holder, but it looks pretty cool.

steps.title: Push a foam ring over the pipe's end down to the ammo holder.
steps.content: Push a foam ring over the pipe's end down to the ammo holder. Slice a 1 in (2.5 cm) ring off a foam pool noodle with a sharp knife. Push the long piece of pipe through the center of the pool noodle ring until it’s flush with the ammo holder. [20] X Research source

steps.title: Load 1 Nerf dart into the end of the long pipe.
steps.content: Load 1 Nerf dart into the end of the long pipe. Hold the blow gun so the end with the nail is closest to you and the longer end extends out in front of you. Drop 1 Nerf dart into the end without the nail. It should slide easily down the tube and rest against the nail. [21] X Research source If you added the ammo holder, stick 6 Nerf darts into the short pipes so they’re ready to use. [22] X Research source

steps.title: Aim at your target and blow into the pipe to shoot the dart.
steps.content: Aim at your target and blow into the pipe to shoot the dart. Find yourself a good target and take aim. Then, put your mouth to the end of the pipe that’s closest to the nail, take a deep breath, and blow to launch the Nerf dart! [23] X Research source Paper plates are great homemade targets to practice with. If you're in a "battle," try using a cardboard box as a shield. [24] X Research source
